item.title: How to structure learning for maximum return
item.description:
Photo by Tim Gouw on Unsplash
In IT, it’s very difficult to keep up-to-date. A full-time job doesn’t give you a chance to upskill or try new things because you’re too busy dealing with legacy code, developing features, etc. Yet, self-development is an important thing and I’ve tried my best over years to make it a habit. For the few past years, I’ve conducted a few experiments towards self-improvement, and I’d like to share a few of those here.
